Passengers who have visited Botswana, India, Mongolia, Namibia, Nepal, Panama, South Africa, and Tunisia within 15 days of arrival are banned. Passengers from remaining countries are required to present a negative result froma COVID-19 PCR test and undergo 14 day quarantine.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210820043511/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/501086/bangladesh-authorities-to-ease-covid-19-restrictions-nationwide-for-eid-al-adha-july-15-23-update-54

International flights are operational with passenger capacity limits. A negative result from a COVID-19 PCR test taken within 72 hours before departure needs to be presented. Travellers are then needed to undergo 14-day quarantine upon arrival. Fully vaccinated people may self-quarantine.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210822065325/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/509671/bangladesh-authorities-extend-strict-covid-19-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-10-update-55

https://web.archive.org/web/20210830173100/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/514841/bhutan-authorities-continue-nationwide-covid-19-controls-as-of-aug-18-update-32  https://web.archive.org/web/20210830173217/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/10-08-21-covid-19-advisory-for-phuentsholing-public-sc19tf/

Officials continue to enforce COVID-19 restrictions nationwide as of Aug. 18. Several recreational venues, such as movie theaters, dance clubs, and nightclubs, remain closed. The use of facemasks is compulsory in public places. Authorities also require residents to use the Druk Trace application for contact tracing when entering public places, business premises, and public and private hire transport vehicles. Essential gatherings of up to 25 people can occur, provided organizers obtain advance approval from authorities. Officials continue to conduct random COVID-19 testing for travelers, students, teachers, transporters, and business personnel every two weeks. Inter-district travelers must register via the Check Post Management System.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210830173100/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/514841/bhutan-authorities-continue-nationwide-covid-19-controls-as-of-aug-18-update-32  https://web.archive.org/web/20210830173217/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/10-08-21-covid-19-advisory-for-phuentsholing-public-sc19tf/

https://archive.vn/y6bVl  More states are opening schools for higher grades from Aug 2, namely Himachal Pradesh (X-XII), Chhattisgarh (X-XII), Rajasthan (all levels). Exception is West Bengal, where all schools are to be closed for the near future.

https://archive.vn/y6bVl  "All schools to open in AP from Aug 16. Andhra Pradesh  In a high-level meeting held by CM Jagan Mohan Reddy, the Andhra Pradesh government has decided to reopen schools from August 16, 2021 for the 2021-2022 academic session."
https://archive.vn/y6bVl  https://archive.vn/JUJkl  More states are reopening schools / higher grades, but apart from states exceptions, schools are generally closed.

https://archive.vn/hkPIB#selection-1125.0-1129.401  "Kerala: Complete lockdown will be imposed in Kerala on July 31 and August 1 as the state continues to report high number of COVID-19 cases. Kerala on Thursday logged 22,064 new COVID-19 cases and 128 deaths, taking the caseload to 33,49,365 and the death toll to 16,585. State Health minister Veena George said 1,63,098 samples were tested in the last 24 hours and the test positivity rate was 13.53 per cent."
NA

https://archive.vn/8WBAZ#selection-1275.0-1303.98  "Tamil Nadu: Cinema theaters will be allowed to function with 50 occupancy from Monday, provided that all its employees are fully vaccinated. Public access to beach shores shall be permitted while officials are instructed to make sure that vendors in the area are vaccinated. Even shops will be permitted to remain open until 10pm and IT companies will be allowed to function with 100 per cent workforce. Meanwhile, public bus transport going to Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka will be allowed to ply, following strict SOPs. Creche shall be allowed to function provided all staff are vaccinated. Swimming pools can open only for practice sessions with 50 per cent occupancy and it is to be made sure that coaches and students above 18 years old are vaccinated. All places of worship will continue to remain closed to the public on Friday, Saturday and Sunday."    "Maharashtra: https://archive.vn/Pgwbr  "Days after the Maharashtra government modified the lockdown guidelines and allowed malls to reopen only with fully vaccinated staff, the Shopping Centres Association of India (SCAI) on Tuesday decided to shut operations across the state saying that they are not able to operate business with less staff"  .. "It must be noted that the state government had allowed shopping malls to open up last week after months of closure to contain the spread of infections. However, the government had asked the malls to operate only with double-vaccinated employees and also admit only fully-vaccinated patrons."

https://archive.vn/UONfC    Most states have allowed public transport, except for Odisha (https://archive.ph/Gu0oM#selection-1905.0-1902.7)  and Maharashtra: Mumbai remains under level-three category restrictions and has allowed people to travel in local trains only for medical purposes. Those under the essential services category can also travel by local trains.    Delhi  In Delhi, the Metro and public buses have been permitted to operate with 100 per cent seating capacity following the latest order issued by the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA). Standing in the metro will not be allowed. In Noida, the timing for the Aqua line is between 6 am and 10 pm, instead of 7 am to 8 pm.

Noting potential plans for vaccine exemptions on public transport travel in MH.     https://archive.vn/hkPIB#selection-1113.250-1113.340  Maharashtra: Further, the state may allow fully vaccinated people to travel in local trains in Mumbai.

https://archive.vn/gVDFZ -- Assam continues banning public transport inter-district travel, despite citizen protestations (private vehicles are allowed)  https://archive.vn/amWxt -- Chandigarh restriction lifted  https://archive.vn/avqk6; https://archive.vn/EjoNe -- Mumbai (Maharashtra) allows fully vaccinated + essential workers to use metro.
https://archive.vn/iJZ57    Night curfews in place in a number of states.

https://archive.vn/hkPIB#selection-1161.0-1169.300  "MADHYA PRADESH:  The Madhya Pradesh government on Wednesday extended the ban on bus services with Maharashtra till August 4 due to the prevailing Covid-19 situation. The ban on inter-state bus services was in effect till July 28, but has now been stretched for another week. An order in this regard has been issued by the Madhya Pradesh Transport Department and clearly states that no bus from and to Maharashtra will be allowed to operate till coming Wednesday.  As Madhya Pradesh has resumed transport services with Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh and Uttar Pradesh, the bus operators have been directed to ensure that everyone inside their vehicles follow Covid-19 protocols. Failing to do so, the state government will initiate legal action against such bus operators."
Negative PCR requirements across most states  https://archive.vn/UONfC
https://archive.vn/LDNlb    Mandatory negative RT PCR test requirements upto 3 days prior to travel in a number of states, vaccinated people are exempt.

Cargo flights, air bubble routes, and repatriation flights shall continue their services."    https://archive.vn/zO5d7  "International travel  All regularly scheduled international flights remain suspended.|"

https://archive.vn/fXVwJ -- issued in May 2021, still the latest testing guidelines issued by ICMR.   In designated containment zones, anyone symptomatic is offered an RTPCR. In other scenarios, the use of RAT is recommended.   "RTPCR test must not be repeated in any individual who has tested positive once either by RAT or  RTPCR"  "Measures to improve access and availability of testing:  Rapid antigen tests (RATs) were recommended in India for COVID-19 testing in June 2020. However, the  use of these tests is currently limited to containment zones and health care settings. "

Covishield (a version of the OxfordâAstraZeneca vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India)   Covaxin (developed by Bharat Biotech)  Sputnik V (procured by Dr. Reddy's Labs from Russia; still being piloted in select cities and localities)    Note: while Moderna has been approved, there are no recorded instances of its deployment just yet. Schools are set to remain closed in Sri Lanka until at least the first week of September, though Government officials are doubtful that they will be able to reopen schools in September [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818080814/https://www.dailymirror.lk/breaking_news/Reopening-schools-first-week-of-Sept-doubtful-Edu-Minister/108-217864 ]

Authorities suspend gatherings, meetings, conferences, seminars, shopping malls, and educational institutions.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70

The President of Sri Lanka intended that State workers go back to work from August 6th, and allowed interstate travel to facilitate this. Within a few days, interstate travel had been banned. It is likely that this has a knock on effect on the original declaration [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818081302/https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2021/08/05/slco-a05.html ]

Offices can operate on-site with only minimum staff.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70
Public Gatherings are prohibited until September 1st [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818080509/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/8/16/sri-lanka-health-minister-covid-cases ]

Authorities suspend gatherings, meetings, conferences, seminars, shopping malls, and educational institutions.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70
Public Gatherings are prohibited until September 1st [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818080509/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/8/16/sri-lanka-health-minister-covid-cases ]

Authorities suspend gatherings, meetings, conferences, seminars, shopping malls, and educational institutions.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70

Interprovincial bus and train services remain suspended, with exemptions for essential employees. Public transport services within provinces can operate with only seated passengers allowed.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70

Whilst staying at home is recommended, it is not required. However, the main opposition of the Sri Lankan Government is calling for a self-imposed citizen lockdown [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818081757/https://economynext.com/sri-lanka-opposition-calls-for-self-imposed-coronavirus-lockdown-84929/ ]

Only one person from each household can leave the house, except for individuals working in permitted industries or seeking medical help.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70

Interstate Travel is strictly prohibited from August 13th. This seems to be an escalation from the previous system in which occassional concessions were made [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818074813/https://news.lk/news/political-current-affairs/item/32734-inter-province-travel-strictly-prohibited ]

Policy remains unchanged.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70

Quarantine is mandatory upon arrival in Sri Lanka - for vaccinated parties, this is until they can produce a negative PCR test, and for non-vaccinated parties this is for 14 days.  [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818084942/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ ]

Entry remains suspended for most individuals with travel history in the past 14 days to Angola, Botswana, Eswatini (Swaziland), Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, Zambia, Zimbabwe, and all South American countries and territories. However, exceptions are in place for flights with fully-vaccinated passengers and people arriving via the Sri Lanka Tourism Bio Bubble program. Permitted arrivals from most other countries must provide a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours before departure and a completed health declaration form, regardless of vaccination status. They must also undergo another PCR test upon arrival. International arrivals who have not been fully vaccinated must quarantine for 14 days at designated facilities while fully vaccinated arrivals are only required to quarantine for one day.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70
No change in Policy [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818165324/https://www.cbsl.gov.lk/en/covid-19-debt-moratorium-and-banking-sector-regulatory-measures ]
Policy remains unchanged.
No change in Policy [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818165324/https://www.cbsl.gov.lk/en/covid-19-debt-moratorium-and-banking-sector-regulatory-measures ]
Policy remains unchanged.
The Sri Lankan Government has a consistently updated website [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818084348/https://news.lk/news/covid-19 ]

Updated information are constantly provided to the public through the Ministry of Health's Epidemiology Unit official website.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210808143551/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=225&Itemid=518&lang=en
PCR tests are readily available in Sri Lanka [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818084942/https://lk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ ]
Policy remains unchanged.
Sri Lanka's contact tracing can best be seen in its meticulous daily reports [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818084348/https://news.lk/news/covid-19 ]
Policy remains unchanged.

Face coverings are required in public spaces still operating, such as transport from airports, and Parliament [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818164648/https://www.srilankan.com/en_uk/coporate/emergency-news-detail/525 ] [https://web.archive.org/web/20210818164812/https://www.southasiamonitor.org/sri-lanka/sri-lanka-makes-face-masks-mandatory-parliament ]

Using face masks remains mandatory in public.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210828144450/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/515291/sri-lanka-officials-further-tighten-restrictions-nationwide-through-aug-31-due-to-covid-19-update-70

Whilst it seems that there has been a far wider vaccination program for some time, A government update seems to suggest that in some parts of the country, eligibility currently only extends to over 60's with chronic illness. This was not mentioned whatsoever in any other Sri Lankan Government press releases, which all suggested near universal availability [ https://web.archive.org/web/20210818075034/https://news.lk/news/political-current-affairs/item/32703-vaccination-of-people-over-60-years-in-western-province-begins-tuesday ]

Last batch of AstraZeneca vaccines arrived from Japan. 1.4 million vaccines had been distributed for the first shots since March 2021.  As more than 5 months have passed, nepalese government has strongly encouraged all people to get vaccinated whenever possible.  The government paid for 4 million Moderna vaccines that shall arrive by February 2022.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210823195357/https://kathmandupost.com/national/2021/08/22/last-batch-of-astrazeneca-vaccine-from-japan-arriving-monday

Last batch of AstraZeneca vaccines arrived from Japan.  By late August 2021, 16.5% of the population (out of 30 million nepalese) have taken the first doses and 12.8% have been fully vaccinated.  As more than 5 months have passed, nepalese government has strongly encouraged all people to get vaccinated whenever possible.  The government paid for 4 million Moderna vaccines that shall arrive by February 2022.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210828152604/https://kathmandupost.com/health/2021/08/24/all-you-need-to-know-about-nepal-s-vaccination-status-1629811950

Government officials require teachers, students above 18 years old, public transport workers, and retail staff to undergo vaccination by Aug. 31. School staff must provide proof of vaccination certificates, starting August 1. Most schools have reopened with fewer restrictions for those vaccinated, with the exemption of schools in Sindh.  Schools for all levels (public and private) in Sindh closed on July 24, was set to open on August 8, and its reopening has yet again been delayed to August 19.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210816223618/https://www.dawn.com/news/1639489  https://web.archive.org/web/20210816223353/https://www.geo.tv/latest/363438-shafqat-mehmood-addresses-press-conference-on-schools-covid-19-situation  https://web.archive.org/web/20210816222658/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/508026/pakistan-authorities-continue-to-enforce-covid-19-measures-nationwide-as-of-july-30-update-51  https://web.archive.org/web/20210815212308/https://pk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Sindh Education Minister Syed Sardar Ali Shah said on Tuesday that schools across the province will open from August 23 (Monday).    Announcing the decision after a meeting of the steering committee, the education minister said: "The decision has been taken to open schools from Monday to continue the education journey of children."    He said schools would be opened with 50 per cent attendance and subject to strict compliance with Covid-19 standard operating procedures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210821113540/https://www.dawn.com/news/1641197

Depending on the average monthly wages of the respective sector and the severity with which a sector is affected, the share of income losses incurred during the lockdown period covered by EEC range from 35 per cent in the medium-risk sector to over 100 per cent in the agriculturally dominated medium-low-risk sector. For the 20 million workers in highly affected sectors, the PKR12,000 transfer covers a little over half of their labour income lost due to the crisis.  As of August 14, the Benazir Income Support Programme (BISP) continue to support low income families in Pakistan.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210817000801/https://www.bisp.gov.pk/Detail/ZTM1M2FiMGQtZDI2OS00YmMxLWEzZGEtYTFhOTkyNzM2Yjg4  https://web.archive.org/web/20210817000349/http://ipcig.org/sites/default/files/pub/en/WP188_Pakistan_s_social_protection_response_to_the_COVID_19.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210816204324/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

FY 2021 budget included further increases in health and social spending, tariff and custom duty reductions on food items, an allocation for 'COVID-19 Responsive and Other Natural Calamities Control Program' (PKR 70 billion), a housing package to subsidize mortgages (PKR 30 billion), as well as the provision of tax incentives to the construction sector (retail and cement companies) which got extended in the context of the second wave to the end of December 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210816204324/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Pakistan is to ban staff from entering public offices, schools, restaurants, transport and shopping malls without vaccination certificates. Certificate would be required for air travel and school staff from Aug. 1 and from the end of August for employees of malls, restaurants, public transport and public sector offices. Students aged above 18 will also be required to be vaccinated.  On June 3, all individuals above 18 may register for innoculation at a vaccination centre. On August 6, Pakistan has opened up vaccinations for 16-18 year olds who need to travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210817012246/https://ncoc.gov.pk/covid-vaccination-en.php  https://web.archive.org/web/20210817013410/https://www.reuters.com/world/china/pakistan-ban-public-sector-education-malls-air-travel-unvaccinated-2021-07-29/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210817013929/https://gulfnews.com/world/asia/pakistan/pakistan-begins-vaccination-of-18-year-olds-to-reach-target-of-70m-this-year-1.79653866  https://web.archive.org/web/20210817014051/https://www.geo.tv/latest/363808-pakistan-opens-coronavirus-vaccines-to-16-18-year-olds-who-need-to-travel
